frame.name: Body_mark
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame a <fen>Body_mark</fen> is present on a <fen>Possessor</fen>'s body. It may be located at an <fen>Attachment</fen> and have a <fen>Descriptor</fen>. A <fen>Cause</fen> may also be indicated. It may be a temporary condition or a permanent one.
<ex> <fex name="Possessor">Mark</fex> has a <fex name="Descriptor">cancerous</fex> <fex name="Body_mark"><t>mole</t></fex> <fex name="Attachment">on his back</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Attachment
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Attachment</fen> is the larger body part to which the <fen>Body_mark</fen> is attached, or of which it is a part. <ex>Mark has a cancerous <t>mole</t> <fex name="Attachment">on his back</fex>.</ex> <ex>The <t>warts</t> <fex name="Attachment">of her left hand</fex> shocked everyone.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Body_mark
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Body_mark</fen>.
<ex>Mark has a cancerous <fex name="Body_mark"><t>mole</t></fex> on his back.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element is used for a characteristic or description of the <fen>Body_mark</fen>. it identifies a modifier of its head noun.
<ex>Mark has a <fex name="Desc">cancerous</fex> <t>mole</t> on his back.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element denotes the <fen>Possessor</fen> of the <fen>Body_mark</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Poss">Mark</fex> has a cancerous <t>mole</t> on his back.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> is the event that brings about the presence of the <fen>Body_mark</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>A specific kind of the particular <fen>Body_mark</fen>.
<ex>Well, looks like you got a <fex name="typ">plantar</fex> <t>wart</t> on your palm there.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: wart.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small, hard, benign growth on the skin, caused by a virus

lexUnit.name: pimple.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small, hard inflamed spot on the skin

lexUnit.name: blackhead.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a plug of sebum in a hair follicle, darkened by oxidation

lexUnit.name: scar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mark left on the skin or within body tissue after the healing of a wound or burn

lexUnit.name: mole.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small dark blemish on the skin caused by a high concentration of melanin.

lexUnit.name: blemish.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small mark or flaw which spoils the appearance of something.

lexUnit.name: birthmark.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a coloured mark on the body which is there from birth.

lexUnit.name: freckle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small light brown spot on the skin, often becoming more pronounced through exposure to the sun

lexUnit.name: zit.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a pimple

lexUnit.name: boil.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an inflamed pus-filled swelling on the skin.

lexUnit.name: blister.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small bubble on the skin filled with serum and typically caused by friction or burning or a similar swelling, filled with air or fluid, on a surface.

lexUnit.name: rash.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area of reddening of a person's skin, sometimes with raised spots.

lexUnit.name: love bite.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: temporary red mark on the skin caused by biting or sucking during sexual play.

lexUnit.name: liver spot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small brown spot on the skin, especially as caused by a skin condition such as lentigo.

lexUnit.name: blotch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large irregular patch or unsightly mark.

lexUnit.name: pustule.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small blister or pimple containing pus.

lexUnit.name: cold sore.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an inflamed blister in or near the mouth, caused by infection with the herpes simplex virus.

lexUnit.name: callus.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thickened and hardened part of the skin or soft tissue, especially one caused by friction.

lexUnit.name: sore.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a raw or painful place on the body.

lexUnit.name: bedsore.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sore that develops as a result of lying in bed in one position for a prolonged period.

lexUnit.name: acne.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: numerous red pimples resulting from inflamed sebaceous glands.
